info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 10:18PM MDT until September 19 at 11:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Far southern Dona Ana County in New Mexico and parts of El Paso County in Texas.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM MDT, Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall continue to affect parts of the El Paso area. The heaviest rainfall is now falling on the east side and Fort Bliss, with another area of heavier rain near Clint. While the storms have produced torrential downpours, they are moving east steadily, reducing the risk of more serious flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Central and East El Paso, Fort Bliss, Clint, Sunland Park, San Elizario, and Socorro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
